title: Ticket #1629: Error message (and/or usage) on "-avgqueuetime" is confusing
description:
When I enter the following, I get this err:

% condor_q -avgqueuetime 426.81
Error: unrecognized argument -avgqueuetime

Should probably either update error message to reflect its dependence on quill, or alternatively update the usage to mention it.

Or maybe better yet put "#ifdef WANT_QUILL" around the -avgqueuetime blurb in the usage.
remarks:
2010-Aug-30 14:15:10 by matt:
Could also implement the option for non-quill queries. 

#define quill_avg_time_template_pgsql "SELECT avg(now() - QDate) \
         FROM \
           (SELECT \
             c.QDate AS QDate, \
             (CASE WHEN p.JobStatus ISNULL THEN c.JobStatus ELSE p.JobStatus END) AS JobStatus \
            FROM (select cluster_id, proc_id, \
          	        NULL AS QDate, \
              	    jobstatus AS JobStatus \
	              FROM procads_horizontal where cluster_id != 0) AS p, \
                 (select cluster_id, \
 	                qdate AS QDate, \
	                jobstatus AS JobStatus \
	              FROM clusterads_horizontal where cluster_id != 0) AS c \
            WHERE p.cluster_id = c.cluster_id) AS h \
         WHERE (jobStatus != 3) and (jobstatus != 4)"
